definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: long (for) (Ar. kasafa be colourless, obscure, be eclipsed (of sun or moon); also be depressed in appearance Ba:ES 61; mod. Ar. disappoint; refl. conjj. be disappointed, ashamed, v. Spiro:Vocab; NH [[כסף]] Hiph. shew pallor, be pale, white; Qal be ashamed, long for, cf. Aram. [[כְּסַף]])—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Impf. 2 ms. [[יׇדֶי ְתִּכְסָׂף לְמַעֲשֵׂה]] Job 14:15 for the work of thy hands thou wouldest long; 3 ms. [[כְּאַרְיֵה יִכְסוֹף לִטְרָׂף]] Ps 17:12 like a lion that longeth to rend.

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pf. 2 ms. + Inf. abs. [[נִכְסׂף נִכְסַפְתָּה לְבֵית אָבִיְ]] Ge 31:30 thou didst long sorely for thy father's house; Pf. 3 fs. ´[[נַפְשִׁי לְחַחְרוֹת י]] …[[נִכְסְפָה ]] Ps 84:4 my soul longeth .…for the courts of ´[[י]]; Pf. 3 ms. [[הַגּוֹי לאׁ נִכְסָָף]] Zep 2:1 very dub.; but perhaps (Ges Ew Hi Ke al.), O nation not turning pale, = not ashamed, cf. etym. supr.; We thinks whole v. corrupt.
